candidates.name: Margaret Cousins
candidates.why_elect: As a long time resident and member of a western hill's residents association and a founding member of Friends of Belmont Regional Park I have strong links to communities that make up the ward and directly understand the issues that are of day-to-day concern.
candidates.why_stand: To continue to protect my ward's communities amenity and environmental values as part of the positive contribution they make to the enhancement of our city and to continue to advocate on issues of concern eg Melling interchange, Kennedy-Good intersection which impact on the daily lives of residents.

candidates.name: Chris Milne
candidates.why_elect: I have skills which are in short supply around the council table—legal, accounting, finance, banking and practical business experience, and I've written an environmental law textbook.
candidates.why_stand: I enjoy giving back to the community, meeting people, helping address issues and making the city a better place for everyone.

candidates.name: Chris Parkin
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Lower Hutt for most of my life, the last three years in Kelson with my family. I've been Co-President of Hutt Playcentre Association, as well as on the national team. I've also been President of Rotorua Camera Club and can draw from those experiences.
candidates.why_stand: I want to serve in a council that manages the opportunities and challenges that climate change will bring to Hutt City. I also want to be part of a council that is proactive on consulting the community at the start of projects as well, as throughout the development.
